news_header: A Palestinian and an Israeli reflect on their friendship amid the backdrop of conflict in the West Bank, as their documentary 'No Other Land' gains international recognition.
news_original_title: Oscar-nominated West Bank feature director says films 'can be part of change'
news_text: The documentary 'No Other Land' follows the friendship between Palestinian Basel Adra and Israeli journalist Yuval Abraham as they document the struggles of Basel's community in Masafer Yatta, which faces displacement and violence from Israeli forces. The film has been nominated for an Oscar and a Bafta, highlighting their hopes for change despite the ongoing conflict. The narrative includes personal stories of loss and resilience, as well as the broader context of Israeli-Palestinian tensions, settler violence, and international responses to the situation.
